leaderUpgrades.name: Aggressive
leaderUpgrades.definition: Each turn, one unit within 12” of this unit may automatically pass an Attack or Move activation without needing to roll dice (may be used on this own unit).

leaderUpgrades.name: Esoterist
leaderUpgrades.definition: For each HQ with this trait, you may reroll any one set of dice in its entirety, rolled by any player.

leaderUpgrades.name: Champion
leaderUpgrades.definition: In Challenges, this unit is only hit on a 6, and treats the opposing Leader's armor as if it was 1. If this unit isn't the Leader, it can perform Challenges anyway.

leaderUpgrades.name: Brutal
leaderUpgrades.definition: Any unit within 12" of this unit may automatically pass a failed Rally or Courage test by removing 1 Strength Point (the very real threat of enforced sacrifice really does make a warrior much bolder).

leaderUpgrades.name: Chaplain
leaderUpgrades.definition: Each turn, you may reroll 1 additional failed Move, Attack, or Shoot activation test (no other tests) within 12" of your Leader's unit.

leaderUpgrades.name: Vexilla
leaderUpgrades.definition: This unit and units within 12" may reroll each of its Courage tests once.

leaderUpgrades.name: Drunkard or Eccentric
leaderUpgrades.definition: After deployment but before the first turn, roll to see how much this unit has drunk. On a 1-2, the HQ drank too much and cannot be ordered on the first round. On a 3-6, the HQ counts as Massive.

leaderUpgrades.name: Impulsive
leaderUpgrades.definition: Each turn, one unit within 12" of this unit may automatically pass a Move or Shoot activation without needing to roll dice (may be used on this own unit).

leaderUpgrades.name: Mortifactor
leaderUpgrades.definition: Vehicles within 12" of the Leader's unit always count as being in cover.

leaderUpgrades.name: Unflinching
leaderUpgrades.definition: When required to Retreat, this unit retreats only 1".

leaderUpgrades.name: Indomitable
leaderUpgrades.definition: During Attacks, this unit may reroll up to 3 failed hit dice.

leaderUpgrades.name: Patient
leaderUpgrades.definition: Any unit within 12" of your Leader's unit may choose to ignore a Wild Charge activation (may be used on this own unit).

leaderUpgrades.name: Rash
leaderUpgrades.definition: This unit gains the Wild Charge rule. Cannot be purchased if the Leader's unit already has Wild Charge.

leaderUpgrades.name: Gun Master
leaderUpgrades.definition: Units within 12" of this unit may automatically pass a Shoot activation without needing to roll dice (may be used on this own unit).

leaderUpgrades.name: Warmaster
leaderUpgrades.definition: Ths unit automatically passes all Move, Attack and Shoot activation tests. Wild Charges, Counter-charges, and Brace are tested as normal. Leader only.

leaderUpgrades.name: Quick
leaderUpgrades.definition: Increase this unit's maximum movement distance by 2".

leaderUpgrades.name: Armistus
leaderUpgrades.definition: At the start of the game, select one Upgrade from an enemy unit, which doesn't apply for this game. Can't affect Veteran, Increased Squad Size, or Massive Squads.

leaderUpgrades.name: Siegebreaker
leaderUpgrades.definition: At the start of the game, declare 1 enemy Vehicle, Fortification, or Cumbersome unit, which has its Armor reduced by 1. Doesn't stack.

leaderUpgrades.name: Centurion
leaderUpgrades.definition: May add or subtract 1 from your total (your choice) when rolling to decide attacker/ defender as described in Chapter 5. Doesn't stack.

factions.name: The Lost and Damned
additionalRules: The Lost and Damned armies may take 1 Greater Daemon, one of the strongest units in the game, but may not have more than 1.

factions.name: Loyalist Astartes
additionalRules: Legiones Astartes armies may have 1 Praetor, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1. Additionally all their HQs get either Bloodthirsty or Fearsome for free.

factions.name: Heretic Astartes
additionalRules: Legiones Astartes armies may have 1 Praetor, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1. Additionally all their HQs get either Bloodthirsty or Fearsome for free.

factions.name: Dark Angels
additionalRules: Legiones Astartes armies may have 1 Praetor, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1. Additionally all their HQs get either Bloodthirsty or Fearsome for free. Dark Angels only: Each unit in your army benefits from only one of your army bonuses (Stormwing, Deathwing, or Ravenwing). Choose which one when deploying that unit.

factions.name: Emperor's Children
additionalRules: Legiones Astartes armies may have 1 Praetor, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1. Additionally all their HQs get either Bloodthirsty or Fearsome for free.

factions.name: Iron Warriors
additionalRules: Legiones Astartes armies may have 1 Praetor, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1. Additionally all their HQs get either Bloodthirsty or Fearsome for free.

factions.name: White Scars
additionalRules: Legiones Astartes armies may have 1 Praetor, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1. Additionally all their HQs get either Bloodthirsty or Fearsome for free.

factions.name: Space Wolves
additionalRules: Legiones Astartes armies may have 1 Praetor, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1. Additionally all their HQs get either Bloodthirsty or Fearsome for free.

factions.name: Imperial Fists
additionalRules: Legiones Astartes armies may have 1 Praetor, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1. Additionally all their HQs get either Bloodthirsty or Fearsome for free. Imperial Fists only: Each Infantry or HQ unit may upgrade with Bolter Discipline for free.

factions.name: Night Lords
additionalRules: Legiones Astartes armies may have 1 Praetor, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1. Additionally all their HQs get either Bloodthirsty or Fearsome for free.

factions.name: Blood Angels
additionalRules: Legiones Astartes armies may have 1 Praetor, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1. Additionally all their HQs get either Bloodthirsty or Fearsome for free.

factions.name: Iron Hands
additionalRules: Legiones Astartes armies may have 1 Praetor, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1. Additionally all their HQs get either Bloodthirsty or Fearsome for free.

factions.name: World Eaters
additionalRules: Legiones Astartes armies may have 1 Praetor, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1. Additionally all their HQs get either Bloodthirsty or Fearsome for free.

factions.name: Ultramarines
additionalRules: Legiones Astartes armies may have 1 Praetor, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1. Additionally all their HQs get either Bloodthirsty or Fearsome for free.

factions.name: Death Guard
additionalRules: Legiones Astartes armies may have 1 Praetor, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1. Additionally all their HQs get either Bloodthirsty or Fearsome for free.

factions.name: Thousand Sons
additionalRules: Legiones Astartes armies may have 1 Praetor, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1. Thousand Sons: Additionally all their HQ and Infantry units get Lesser Psyker for free.

factions.name: Sons of Horus
additionalRules: Legiones Astartes armies may have 1 Praetor, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1. Additionally all their HQs get either Bloodthirsty or Fearsome for free.

factions.name: Word Bearers
additionalRules: Legiones Astartes armies may have 1 Praetor, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1. Additionally all their HQs get either Bloodthirsty or Fearsome for free.

factions.name: Salamanders
additionalRules: Legiones Astartes armies may have 1 Praetor, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1. Additionally all their HQs get either Bloodthirsty or Fearsome for free.

factions.name: Raven Guard
additionalRules: Legiones Astartes armies may have 1 Praetor, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1. Additionally all their HQs get either Bloodthirsty or Fearsome for free.

factions.name: Alpha Legion
additionalRules: Legiones Astartes armies may have 1 Praetor, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1. Additionally all their HQs get either Bloodthirsty or Fearsome for free. Alpha Legion only: You may take any Legion-specific unit.

factions.name: Questoris Knights
additionalRules: A Questoris Knights army may nominate a Vehicle as a Leader, but it cannot have Leader Traits. To compensate for this and the low unit count, you may upgrade your units with Double Time for free.

factions.name: Cult Mechanicum
additionalRules: Cult Mechanicum armies may have 1 Archmagos Prime, a particularly strong HQ unit, but they may not have more than 1.

factions.name: Talons of the Emperor
additionalRules: Units in a Talons of the Emperor army get their choice of Bloodthirsty or Fearsome for free.

factions.name: Solar Auxilia
additionalRules: You may upgrade Vehicles to Veteran for 4 points each (8 for Superheavy Tanks), an option usually reserved for Infantry.

upgrades.name: Fearsome
upgrades.definition: Some people are just that much scarier than others, especially if in power armor! A Fearsome unit creates panic in its opponents through reputation, deed, or other psychological means. Courage tests caused as a result of this unit Attacking or Shooting suffer an additional -1 to the total. Should two Fearsome units encounter one another, the effect of this rule is cancelled between those units

upgrades.name: Dedicated Melee
upgrades.definition: Enemy Infantry and HQ units count as Armor 2 in melee against this unit. Range is reduced by 12”. Cannot be taken alongside Anti-Tank or Anti-Infantry

upgrades.name: Bolter Discipline
upgrades.definition: The unit gains Rapid Fire. If it already had it, it triggers Rapid Fire on rolls of 5-6 instead of 6.

upgrades.name: Bloodthirsty
upgrades.definition: A Bloodthirsty unit can inflict a whole load of additional pain on an enemy – if it rolls well. Any Attack dice or Shooting dice (but not Defence dice) that roll a 6 cause 2 hits rather than the usual 1 hit. This stacks with other rules like Great Strength and Rapid Fire.

upgrades.name: Veteran
upgrades.definition: Veteran units are often drawn from specific legions or disciplines. These units get +1 to all order rolls, as well as to their Attack Value, Defense Value and Shooting Value. Cannot be mixed with Increased Squad Size.

upgrades.name: Javelins
upgrades.definition: Shoot 6+/Range 6” hitting on 5+

upgrades.name: Double Time
upgrades.definition: Once per game, this unit may receive two orders, instead of the usual one. You declare one order first and the other afterwards when doing this.

upgrades.name: Transport
upgrades.definition: At the start of the game, nominate a friendly Infantry unit that isn't Cumbersome to be embarked in each transport you have. Do not deploy embarked units normally. At the end of the first or second round, deploy Embarked units within 6” of their specific Transport. If the Transport is destroyed, its embarked unit deploys within 2” of the Transport's immediate location before it was destroyed.

upgrades.name: Javelins Only
upgrades.definition: Most units are armed with bows, but these are instead armed with javelins, with range reduced to 6”.

upgrades.name: Mixed Weapons
upgrades.definition: Add Shoot 6+, Range 12” hitting on 5+. Remove Defensive Formation and cannot be combined with javelins

upgrades.name: Stakes
upgrades.definition: Defense 3+/Movement 3”

upgrades.name: Lesser Psyker
upgrades.definition: Once per round, this unit may suffer 1 strength point to reroll any dice in a set of dice.

upgrades.name: Mighty Weapons
upgrades.definition: +1 to Attack Value. Remove Defensive Formation

upgrades.name: Jump Pack
upgrades.definition: Fly and +2 Movement Distance. Cannot be combined with Terminator Armor or Bike.

upgrades.name: Bike
upgrades.definition: Cumbersome, Fast and +6 Movement Distance. Cannot be combined with Jump Pack or Terminator Armor.

upgrades.name: Shamsir Jetbike
upgrades.definition: Cumbersome, Fast, +1 Armor and +6 Movement Distance. Cannot be combined with Jump Pack, Bike or Terminator Armor.

upgrades.name: Terminator Armor
upgrades.definition: Deep Strike, Cumbersome and Heavily Armored, but -1 Movement Distance. Cannot be combined with Jump Pack or Bike.

upgrades.name: Medicae
upgrades.definition: +1 Armor.

upgrades.name: Bayonet
upgrades.definition: +1 to Defence Value, but Range is reduced by 6”.

upgrades.name: Snipers
upgrades.definition: HQ units count as armor 1 against Shooting by this unit (even in cover) and the unit has +2 to its Shooting orders. Cannot be takn alongside Anti-Infantry or Anti-Tank.

upgrades.name: Increased Squad Size
upgrades.definition: +5 to Strength Points, and counts as a Massive unit when calculating attack dice. Cannot be mixed with Veteran.

upgrades.name: Massive Squads
upgrades.definition: +10 to Strength Points. Cannot be mixed with Veteran.

upgrades.name: Anti-Tank
upgrades.definition: Weapons such as Plasma Weapons, Lascannons and Melta Weapons are Anti-Tank weapons. Vehicle, Cumbersome and Fortification units count as armor 2 against Shooting by this unit (armor 3 if in cover). Shooting Value is 6+ against any other units. Cannot be taken alongside Anti-Infantry.

upgrades.name: Anti-Infantry
upgrades.definition: Weapons such as Flamers, Volkite Weapons and Grenade weapons are Anti-Infantry weapons. HQ and Infantry units count as armor 2 against Shooting by this unit (isn't affected by Cover).  Shooting Value is 6+ against any other units. Cannot be taken alongside Anti-Tank.

keywords.name: Fearsome
keywords.definition: Some people are just that much scarier than others, especially if in power armor! A Fearsome unit creates panic in its opponents through reputation, deed, or other psychological means. Courage tests caused as a result of this unit Attacking or Shooting suffer an additional -1 to the total. Should two Fearsome units encounter one another, the effect of this rule is cancelled between those units

keywords.name: Fearless
keywords.definition: This unit is not affected by Fearsome or Panic enemy units.

keywords.name: Wild Charge
keywords.definition: If an enemy unit is within this unit’s Attack range during the ‘Activate Wild Charges’ phase, you must test to activate an Attack against it. If the test is unsuccessful, the unit remains stationary but may test for an ordered activation later in your turn. Wild Charge may not be used if the unit is Battered.

keywords.name: Bloodthirsty
keywords.definition: A Bloodthirsty unit can inflict a whole load of additional pain on an enemy – if it rolls well. Any Attack dice or Shooting dice (but not Defence dice) that roll a 6 cause 2 hits rather than the usual 1 hit. This stacks with other rules like Great Strength and Rapid Fire.

keywords.name: Counter-charge
keywords.definition: When an enemy has successfully rolled to Attack this unit, but before it moves, this unit may test for a Counter-charge. Test for an Attack at 7+. If it succeeds, the two units meet a proportionate movement distance between their start positions, and both count as Attacking. If it fails, it stands in place for the enemy’s charge. Counter-charge may not be used if the unit is Battered.

keywords.name: Counter-charge vs Infantry and HQ
keywords.definition: When an enemy has successfully rolled to Attack this unit, but before it moves, this unit may test for a Counter-charge. Test for an Attack at 7+. If it succeeds, the two units meet a proportionate movement distance between their start positions, and both count as Attacking. If it fails, it stands in place for the enemy’s charge. Counter-charge may not be used if the unit is Battered.

keywords.name: Deep Strike
keywords.definition: At deployment, this unit is held in reserve. At the start of the first or second round, place this unit anywhere on the table, but no closer than 6” from any enemy models.

keywords.name: Fly
keywords.definition: This unit ignores all benefits and downsides of all terrain, but may not end in terrain that is impassable. For example, such a unit may move through rough terrain without penalties, but may not benefit from Cover granted by terrain. Additionally, a unit with this rule may not embark in a Transport.

keywords.name: Dedicated Melee
keywords.definition: Enemy Infantry and HQ units count as Armor 2 in melee against this unit.

keywords.name: Go Back to your Farms
keywords.definition: You may select no more than 3 Levied Infantry units in a 24-point army (scale up or down proportionately for armys of different points values).

keywords.name: Fast
keywords.definition: This unit does not halve its movement in rough terrain.

keywords.name: Bombardment
keywords.definition: At the start of the first round, may Shoot without rolling for orders. This doesn't count as an activtion and as such it may shoot twice on the first round - once from bombardment, the other from actiivation.

keywords.name: Cumbersome
keywords.definition: Cannot embark on Transports or benefit from cover.

keywords.name: Brace
keywords.definition: When an enemy has successfully rolled to Attack this unit, but before it moves, this unit may test to Brace at 6+. If it succeeds, it immediately carries out a Skirmish action targeting the Attacking unit, may not move closer to the Attacking unit, and must avoid other units by 3” as usual. Any casualties inflicted by the Skirmish action cause a Courage test only at the end of the Attack. The charging unit then moves its full charge distance following the Bracing unit. If it makes contact it Attacks with the Bracing unit reducing its armor by 1, and if it cannot contact it must move as close as possible (moving no closer than 3” to the Bracing unit). If the Brace test fails, the unit stands in place and awaits attack without Shooting or Moving. A Bracing unit will always fight when contacted, and a unit may Brace as many times as it wishes in a turn. Brace cannot be used if the unit is Battered

keywords.name: Skirmish
keywords.definition: As an ordered activation, successful on a 7+, the unit may make a half Move and Shoot (in either order). All models in the unit Shoot with -1 to their dice scores.

keywords.name: Hard to target
keywords.definition: This unit counts as having +1 armor versus Shooting and may only be targeted within 12”.

keywords.name: Shielded
keywords.definition: This unit counts as having +1 armor versus Melee and ignores rules that reduce armor (like Anti-Infantry).

keywords.name: Heavily Armored
keywords.definition: This unit has +1 armor after any modifiers (such as Anti-Infantry).

keywords.name: Selfsufficent
keywords.definition: This unit may receive orders even if you failed an order this turn.

keywords.name: Great Strength
keywords.definition: Any Attack dice or Defence dice that roll a 6 cause 2 hits rather than the usual 1 hit.

keywords.name: Rapid Fire
keywords.definition: Any Shooting dice that roll a 6 cause 2 hits rather than the usual 1 hit.

keywords.name: Panic
keywords.definition: When this unit Shoots or Attacks, the target unit must take a Courage test regardless of the number of hits inflicted.

armyBonuses.name: Wild
armyBonuses.definition: All units in this army (except Fortifications, Combat Vehicles, Tanks and Superheavy Tanks) gain Wild Charge. Additionally, they may choose to automatically fail Wild Charge tests.

armyBonuses.name: Know no Fear
armyBonuses.definition: All units in this army (except Fortifications) gain Fearless.

armyBonuses.name: Hardened Armor
armyBonuses.definition: All Infantry and HQ units in this army have +1 to their Armor, after any modifiers (such as Anti-Infantry).

armyBonuses.name: Stormwing
armyBonuses.definition: A Stormwing unit may reroll Shooting dice of 1. Fortifications in a Dark Angels army must be Stormwing.

armyBonuses.name: Deathwing
armyBonuses.definition: A Deathwing unit may reroll Attack dice of 1.

armyBonuses.name: Ravenwing
armyBonuses.definition: A Ravenwing unit increases its Movement Distance by 2”.

armyBonuses.name: Exemplars of War
armyBonuses.definition: All units in this army (except Fortifications) increase their Movement Distance by 3”.

armyBonuses.name: Enhanced Senses
armyBonuses.definition: An Army with this bonus ignores the armor boost granted by Cover.

armyBonuses.name: Wrack and Ruin
armyBonuses.definition: Select one enemy unit at the start of the battle, which must be a Vehicle or Fortification if possible. For the entire battle, it has its Armor reduced to 1, and cannot benefit from any modifiers to Armor.

armyBonuses.name: Swift Action
armyBonuses.definition: All units in this army (except Fortifications) succeed Move actions automatically.

armyBonuses.name: Bestial Savagery
armyBonuses.definition: All units in this army (except Fortifications) gain Counter-charge.

armyBonuses.name: A Talent for Murder
armyBonuses.definition: All units in this army gain Fearsome.

armyBonuses.name: Shrouded
armyBonuses.definition: All units in this army gain Hard to target, but only during the round in which they deploy.

armyBonuses.name: Encarmine Fury
armyBonuses.definition: All units in this army may reroll Attack and Defence dice of 1.

armyBonuses.name: Tech Mastery
armyBonuses.definition: All Vehicle and Fortification units in this army have +1 to their armor, after any modifiers (such as Anti-Tank).

armyBonuses.name: Bloodlust
armyBonuses.definition: All units in this army have Wild Charge and may choose whether or not to succeed Wild Charge tests, instead of rolling for Wild Charges normally.

armyBonuses.name: Fire Support!
armyBonuses.definition: Friendly Infantry units within 12” of another friendly Infantry unit succeed automatically on Shooting orders, and have a +1 modifier to their Shooting dice.

armyBonuses.name: Ceaseless
armyBonuses.definition: All units in this army gain Skirmish. If they already had Skirmish, they perform Skirmish orders at 3+.

armyBonuses.name: Covenant of Sorcerors
armyBonuses.definition: After deploying, for every Lesser Psyker or Esoterist unit in your army, roll one die and set it apart for later - these are Fate dice. Make sure they are distinguishable from normal dice. At any point after the start of the first round, you may swap any dice with one of your Fate dice, reducing the amount of Fate dice you have by 1.

armyBonuses.name: Merciless Warriors
armyBonuses.definition: All units in this army may reroll Attack and Shooting dice (but not Defence dice) of 1.

armyBonuses.name: Charismatic Leadership
armyBonuses.definition: As long as your Leader is on the table, all units in this army have +1 to all Orders and Courage tests.

armyBonuses.name: Behemoths
armyBonuses.definition: Vehicles in this army treat their Armor as 3 against Anti-Tank, instead of as 1.

armyBonuses.name: Self-Reliant
armyBonuses.definition: Failing an order doesn't end the turn for this army.

armyBonuses.name: Fix Bayonets!
armyBonuses.definition: Lasrifle Sections in this army may, at the start of a round, swap between having or not having the Bayonet upgrade.
